Psychology_tweet_92_p$Psychology_tweet_1.text:
Finding A: As with the missing circumcisions performed by religious circumcisers, such non-differential exposure misclassification will most likely produce conservative estimates of any real difference in ASD risk between circumcised and intact boys.
Finding B: Practitioners who aim to facilitate effective goal setting in sport, business, and educational settings would benefit from guidelines for developing autonomous motivation.
Finding C: They also shed light on the disruption in brain functioning in general and connectivity in particular in autism when challenged by complex tasks like ToM.
Finding D: Another finding was the reduced activation in the cerebellum, specifically in Crus I, in the ASD group.

Finding A: As with the missing circumcisions performed by religious circumcisers, such non-differential exposure misclassification will most likely produce conservative estimates of any real difference in ASD risk between circumcised and intact boys.

Finding C: They also shed light on the disruption in brain functioning in general and connectivity in particular in autism when challenged by complex tasks like ToM.

Psychology_tweet_1_p$Psychology_tweet_57.text:
Finding A: Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).
Finding B: A neural link between poor sleep and depression:
Finding C: Thus, irrespective of whether infants had to initiate a saccadic eye movement to a single item or to a stimulus item in the presence of a competing item, those who were delivered by caesarean section took longer to allocate attention and initiate that eye movement than did those who were delivered vaginally.
Finding D: Conclusions: The findings suggest that gender differences in the application of intoxication terms are other-directed as well as self-directed and that intoxication language can inform gender-specific prevention and intervention efforts targeting problematic alcohol use among college students.

Psychology_43_p$Psychology_124_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Risk in this age group was markedly elevated among boys in non-Muslim families (HR ¼ 4.23; 95% CI: 1.90-9.44), a finding based on six ASD cases in circumcised boys versus 1165 cases in intact boys.
Finding B: "Sociosexual orientation is a relatively stable tendency toward or away from casual sex, determined by a combination of heritable factors, sociocultural learning, and past experiences, and reflected in three key components: motivation for, attitudes toward, and past experience with casual sex," the authors write.
Finding C: Understanding the neural connectivity that underlies both conditions and mediates the association between them is likely to lead to better-directed treatments for depression and associated sleep problems.
Finding D: These advances raise possibilities for investigating maturational lag in ADHD in the developing ICN architecture of the brain (18).

Psychology_tweet_147_p$Psychology_430_r$.text:
Finding A: In the context of the chaotic environment combined with an out-of-control mindset, increased cookie consumption might have been the result of depleted selfregulatory strength from managing one\'s emotions under such conditions.
Finding B: Choir members said they felt more connected with their community and had better social functioning in general.
Finding C: "Consumers who knew they had received a targeted ad reported being more interested in the advertised product, and even changed their self-perceptions to be more in line with what the ad implied about them," she explains.
Finding D: A spike in cortisol in athletesa saliva before competition, they wrote, would support the idea that apsychosocial stressorsa can have as strong a biological effect as actual danger.
